content.name: remoteSystem
content.description: Information about remote storage systems that connect to the system to which you are logged in. The system uses the configuration to access and communicate with the remote system. For example, to use remote replication, create a configuration that specifies the remote system to use as the destination for the replication session.

attributes.name: remoteSPBInterfaces
attributes.description: SPB replication interface IP addresses of remote system used in remote system connection configuration.

attributes.name: localSPAInterfaces
attributes.description: SPA replication interface IP addresses of local system used in remote system connection configuration.

attributes.name: remoteSPAInterfaces
attributes.description: SPA replication interface IP addresses of remote system used in remote system connection configuration.

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: Model name of the remote system.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the remoteSystem instance.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: Health information for the remote system, as defined by the health resource  type.

attributes.name: connectionType
attributes.description: Type of the replication connection to the remote system.

attributes.name: altManagementAddressList
attributes.description: Alternate management IP addresses of the remote system.

attributes.name: serialNumber
attributes.description: Serial number of the remote system.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: Username for accessing the remote system.

attributes.name: syncFcPorts
attributes.description: Fibre channel ports used for synchronous replication.

attributes.name: managementAddress
attributes.description: Management IP address of the remote system.

attributes.name: localSPBInterfaces
attributes.description: SPB replication interface IP addresses of local system used in remote system connection configuration.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: System name as reported by system.name on remote system.
